column2: MAINE DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the left side mirror.
column6: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column8: look into the right side mirror.

column2: 2. If a vehicle starts to skid on water the driver should quickly apply the brakes.
3. Sudden wind gusts on highways:
column6: can cause one to lose control of their vehicle.
column8: are generally caused by dust and dirt blowing around.

column2: 4. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column2: 5. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: A road joins from the right
column8: There is a series of sharp turns up ahead on the road

column2: 7. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
8. When parking downhill:
column4: turn your wheels towards the side of the road.
column6: turn your wheels away from the side of the road.

column2: 9. This sign means drivers should:
column4: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.
column6: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column10: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.

column2: 10. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
11. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
12. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 13. When the road is slippery you should:
14. Drivers must yield to pedestrians:
column4: only if the pedestrian is on the same side of the road.
column6: even when the pedestrian crosses the street without looking both ways.
column8: only if the pedestrian is in a crosswalk.
column10: if the pedestrian signals to the driver that the driver must stop.

column2: 15. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column6: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column8: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column10: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.

column2: 16. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
17. When you change lanes:
column4: look in the left side mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.

column2: 18. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: The other answers are both correct.
column6: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column8: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.

column2: 19. Your driving ability can be affected by:
20. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column8: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 21. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column4: help create a safe driving environment.
column6: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column8: You must turn right at the intersection

column2: 23. This road sign means:

26. When an emergency vehicle approaches using a siren, air horn or a red or blue flashing light, drivers must move to the right side of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.
27. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.
28. When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
column4: buckled up in the front seat.
column6: buckled up in the back seat.
column8: in the bed of a pick-up truck.

column2: 29. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column6: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.

column2: 30. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column6: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column8: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.
column10: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.

column2: 31. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
32. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
column6: gives you time to react to situations.

column2: 33. When approaching someone using a white cane or guide dog, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop and invite them to take the right-of-way.
column8: slow down and be prepared to stop.
column10: yield the right-of-way only if the blind person is on the right.

column2: 34. When you come to a flashing yellow light, you must:
column6: speed up to beat the red light.

column2: 35. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
36. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column6: look toward the left side of the road.
column8: look toward the right side of the road.
column10: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.

column2: 37. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column6: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column10: number of cars in front of you.

column2: 38. If driving in foggy weather, drivers should turn on their high-beams to increase the field of vision.
39. This road sign means:
40. In general, you should pass vehicles going in the same direction as you are going:
column6: only if the other driver signals it is safe.
column10: whenever you have the opportunity to do so.

column2: 41. While inside a roundabout, you should stay in your lane until you are ready to exit.
42. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column8: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column10: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 43. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column6: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 44. An orange-colored sign means:

47. While driving you come upon a sign which says, “reduced speed 35 MPH”. You as a driver should know:
column4: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at the next “speed limit” sign.
column6: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at this sign.
column8: that the sign is put there to harass “good” drivers.
column10: that you have plenty of time to slow down before the speed zone.

column2: 48. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column10: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection

column2: 49. A green arrow used to control turns from a specific traffic lane:
column4: is used only on one-way streets.
column6: means that you may go only if the green arrow is accompanied by a green light.
column8: provide directional and mileage information to specific destinations.
column10: means the same as a circular green light, but you must go only in the direction indicated by the arrow.

column2: 50. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: to keep the front wheels straight.
column6: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column8: in the direction you want to go.
column10: in any direction. It doesnt matter.

column2: 51. Railroad crossings should always be considered:
column4: a place where stopping is required.
column10: safe when railroad crossing lights are active.

column2: 52. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column10: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column2: 53. A broken yellow line on your side of the roadway only means:
column4: Passing is not permitted on either side.
column6: Passing is permitted on both sides.
column8: Passing is permitted on your side of the roadway.

column2: 54. A flashing red light at an intersection means:
column4: Come to a complete stop and remain stopped as long as the light is red
column6: Stop and wait for the green light
column10: Stop and yield the right of way.

column2: 55. Drivers under the age of 21 are subject to a specific restriction prohibiting them from driving:
56. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
57. BAC is:
column4: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column6: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.
column10: the amount of alcohol in your body.

column2: 58. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column6: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.
column8: you have put your turn signal on.
column10: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.

column2: 59. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
60. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
